alert.note: Alert for Southwest Desert, Lower Gila River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 4:46PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Showers and thunderstorms producing gusty winds and blowing dust over the Lordsburg Playa through 545 PM MDT... At 441 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking shower and thunderstorm over the Lordsburg Playa. These storms were moving quite slow, and producing gusty outflow winds and kicking up some dust. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph, and blowing dust which could make for dangerous travel along I-10 across the Lordsburg Playa SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause blowing dust, and reduce visibilities. Locations impacted include... Steins, Lordsburg, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa and Shakespeare. This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 3 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If driving and you see blowing dust ahead, pull well off the road and wait the 10-20 minutes it takes for the dust to settle.

area.areaDesc: Southwest Desert, Lower Gila River Valley
